name: Ibis Birmingham City Centre

reviews.title: The worst hotel I've stayed in bar none!!!
reviews.text: It's diabolical, after taking 25 minutes to book in because one of the rooms in our group had been signed out to some one else, a quick drink in the worlds noisiest but atmosphereless bar - I headed to my room. I might as well have been in the bleeding club that is obviously directly beneath the hotel- yep it's 0:45am and it sound likes there's a party going on the next room but without the possibility of getting a drink or meeting some one to share a sh!t hotel room with!!!! Stay away unless you're planning on going to the club beneath!!!!!
The best and worst of the hotel is the location - close to shopping and nightclubs. The clubs are open through the week and the hotel picks up the bass sounds and party-goers.
reviews.title: At least the location is good

reviews.text: The breakfast is expensive; the hot foods are always served cold and at any time a third of the menu (coffee included) may be out. The other meals are terrible.
reviews.title: Double-booked

reviews.text: Booked the IBIS well in advance for a large group to stay 1 night.
reviews.title: Paper thin walls and gangs of drunk women.

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel and was informed that no rooms were available, and all hotels in central Birmingham were full. We were offered a room at their branch at Birmingham Airport which we had no choice but to take. The cover story was an electrical failure on the 3rd floor and all of this was OK because "we would have called you this morning but didn't have your phone number" - which makes it my fault. of course.
reviews.title: Good no frills hotel

reviews.text: very good hotel, clean, modern. excellent location. rooms basic but clean. Breakfast quite poor. Hotel staff very helpful. I really do not have any negative comments for this hotel apart from the fact that they did not have wireless internet in the rooms.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: I stayed a night in September 2006, the hotel is okay, but oh my God the noise!! the hotel is located in the middle of several night and gent's club in the city centre and normally after 12am you have to bear the noise until 3 am !
reviews.title: the hotel is okay, but the NOISE of clubs!!

reviews.text: apart from that, the hotel is okay.
reviews.title: It was fine - but be prepared for the noise!

reviews.text: I stayed here in October while in Birmingham for a weekend. The rooms themselves were basic but clean and perfectly adequate for one night. Location in respect of the city centre was good BUT I was there at the weekend with a room overlooking the bars and restaurants behind the hotel and it was very noisy even with two sets of windows you can't block it out. Because of that I didn't have a great nights sleep although it made some interesting people watching!
reviews.title: Very good, but it was a Tuesday

reviews.text: The hotel was fine, if I wanted somewhere cheap and couldn't find anything else for the same price I probably would put up with it for a night but to be honest for a little bit more money if you can get the cheap rate I would recommend the City Inn which is in a much nicer location and is a fantastic hotel in Birmingham!
reviews.title: What's with the noise!!!!

reviews.text: Cheap, clean, Modern, simple, good staff, ok breakfast. Hotel was quiet despite being located close to so many bars, restaurants etc. I always stay here in brume as it's consistently good, as long as ur not expecting some kind of 5 star hotel. Definitely better than the travelodge!
reviews.title: Better than a travelodge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of the price, location and photos on the hotel website. What a disappointment. Our room was located on the fourth floor and was very small, as was the room next door in which our friends stayed. The bathroom was about the size of an average toilet room including a toilet, very small shower and small basin. There wasn't enough room in the bathroom to comfortably get changed in after having a shower. The room was the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, was clinical white and very basic. The bed was a matress on top of a flat wooden board on four legs - however it was surprisingly comfortable. There was noise outside most of the night due to the area the hotel is situated - lots of bars and clubs. Breakfast was below average - everything appeared chaotic, messy and had been sitting there for a while. The scrambled eggs were clearly made of powdered egg and appeared a gey and yellow colour...yuck! The lifts are extremely slow and the carpet in the halls is well worn and in need of replacing. We would not stay here again...as they say "you get what you pay for".
reviews.title: Don't bother unless you like average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ladywell Walk Ibis on a Tuesday night as we were in town for a gig at the Academy and I have to say that the hotel was perfect for what we were after. Ibis have, for as long as i have known, reputed themselves on providing the basic hotel facilities at a reasonable price and of a high standard, and for us on this occassion they ticked all the boxes. Yes, the room was quite small, but how much time are you spending in there anyway? I can see this could be a problem for people staying for business, but there's always alternatives. The Academy is not 5 minutes walk from the hotel so would highly recommend this to any gig-goer. And yes, the hotel does get a lot of street noise as it is on a main road in the centre of the second largest city in the UK - but what else would you expect? With the window shut it is more than possible to get a good nights sleep. If it's a quiet stay you're after, then go to the countryside. Check in and out was a breeze with friendly staff. The only downside to the stay (and I see quite a few people have commented on this) was the breakfast in the morning - avoid, avoid, avoid. We took one glance at the set up and turned around and walked straight out the door - quickly. However, now that I think of it, we probably would have been better off staying and eating there considering where we ended up!! We'll definately be staying next time we're in Brum for a gig!
reviews.title: Brilliant for a short and simple stay - which is the point of staying at an Ibis

reviews.text: I arrived with a total open mind with regard to this hotel and I certainly wasn't disappointed. The staff are friendly and helpful and eager to make sure that you have the best stay possible. The location of the hotel is ideal for a little holiday because it's close to all the necessities. There's a Tesco Express just up the road and tons of gorgeous restaurants surrounding it. It's also extremely close to the Hippodrome Theatre and the Birmingham O2 Academy (which I was there to visit). Everything you will need is in walking distance. The cleaning staff were also great- quick and efficient. I never had a problem with the cleanliness of the hotel. All in all, everything exceeded my expectations and I had the most pleasant stay possible. Great value for money.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner as a base for a night out with friends. We arrived and parked our car on the public car park across the road, £12.50 for 24hours. The reception area was very clean and the staff were friendly. We arrived in our room to find that it was very small but for a budget hotel in the city centre the main thing is that it is clean, which this undoubtebly was. After reading the reviews on here prior to our stay we requested a quiet room, we returned to our room at 2am, and the music downstairs was very much present. There is no getting away from the fact that this hotel is in a fantastic location, staggering distance from all the pubs and clubs and 2mins from the bullring for a days shopping but if staying for business or for a quiet break this hotel is very much the wrong choice. However, it was perfect for what we needed and as a base for a night out, we would probably stay again. The night staff are also very careful who they let in, as when we returned the doors were locked and we had to show our room card.
reviews.title: if you're staying for the nightlife, it can't be faulted

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of January 2010.
reviews.title: In need of refurbishment

reviews.text: The hotel looks ok from the outside and the reception area is fine too, although nothing fancy.
reviews.title: Check directly with the hotel for better rates!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems to be in a good enough location, apparently in the middle of Chinatown and close to the Bullring.
reviews.title: Much better than expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was in real need of refurbishment, especially the carpet, which looked filthy.
reviews.title: great hotel in a perfectr location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The showeroom was clean and modern.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Great location, Weekend well spent

description: Ibis Birmingham Centre offers 159 contemporary bedrooms with air cooling in the heart of the lively Chinese quarter and adjacent to the Arcadian Centre with its various bars and nightclubs. The Chill Bar at the hotel serves snacks 24 hours per day. 3 min walk from the Birmingham central train station(New Street) and Bullring Shopping Centre. Close to the NIA, ICC and easily accessible by train from NEC. 5 conference rooms for up to 200 delegates. The hotel is easily accessible from the M1, M6 and M42 motorways. Limited Car parking spaces at Hotel and also nearby Public car park.
